pageContext.claim: “California and New York must do something about their TREMENDOUS Homeless problems. They are setting records! If their Governors can’t handle the situation, which they should be able to do very easily, they must call and “politely” ask for help. Would be so easy with competence!”
pageContext.analysis: New York and California do lead the country with the largest homeless populations. But those numbers aren't as simple as they seem. The Post reported, “New York’s homeless population increased, but that could be because the city stepped up efforts to house the homeless and thus converted hard-to-count people living on the streets into easier-to-count people in shelter programs. It appeared as though the city’s homeless population climbed, but it may just be counting better.” Overall, the number of unsheltered homeless people has risen since 2016, but has declined dramatically since 2007.
